thread.title: 13-year-old shot in face when gun goes off in woods at JBLM
thread.title_full: 13-year-old shot in face when gun goes off in woods at JBLM | www.kirotv.com

author: kirotv.com
title: 13-year-old shot in face when gun goes off in woods at JBLM
text:
A 13-year-old boy was shot in the face and critically injured at Joint Base Lewis-McChord Tuesday afternoon.
Lakewood Police say he entered woods on JBLM property through a hole in a fence near the Woodbrook neighborhood, accompanied by his 14-year-old brother and a 17-year-old boy.
Police say a handgun one of the boys had brought into the woods went off.
The 17-year-old boy was detained as investigators sorted out details of the shooting, including whether it was accidental.
Medics took the victim to Mary Bridge Children's Hospital in Tacoma, where his condition Tuesday evening was unknown.
#BREAKING : Police are investigating a shooting in #Lakewood —on JBLM property. #KIRO7 working to learn more. Chopper 7 on the way.
— KIRO 7 (@KIRO7Seattle) October 20, 2015 Officials with West Pierce Fire and Rescue told KIRO 7 the boy was in serious to critical condition as he left the scene.
Lakewood police say they will investigate where the gun was obtained, and will hold accountable any adult who was responsible.
Because the case involves civilians on a military base, the FBI is taking over as the lead investigative agency.
>> KIRO 7 is working to learn more. This story is developing.
